intro: Astephanus recurvatus, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Astephanus recurvatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
